result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amoura P McArthur

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amoura P McArthur appeared by video.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Amoura P McArthur.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  State advises Court that this case will be reissued as a misdemeanor case and requests adjourned status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Amoura P McArthur appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Amoura P McArthur.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.   DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 

Prior to completion of hearing, Court ordered COUNT 1 DISMISSED due to felony charge with misdemeanor penalty.  Case reassigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
There needs to be a hearing on this issue.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Amoura P McArthur not in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/16/22 @ 1:30p
